habitat: at least 50 square feet of living space, time and space to exercize, socialization, mud in which to wallow
food: 2-4 gallons of water per day per pig, commercial pig feed with the appropriate levels of protein and other nutrients, pigs love leftover human food
comments: Size varies. Plan on how to deal with manure and flies.

when_fertile: every 21 days, but cows should only be bred about once each year
when_to_sell_offspring: depends on purpose of sale; bobby calves are milk-fed calves sold under two weeks old, but cows appreciate in value for several years
habitat: cows need adequate shelter, socialization, and room to roam and graze
food: more than 50% of cow food is grass, constant supply of fresh drinking water
comments: Size varies. Regular veterinary appointments are recommended. Cows can be used as milk-producers, meat, breeding stock, and more.

habitat: a lot of space to run, socialization
food: primarily grass and hay, constant supply of fresh drinking water
comments: Size varies. Plan on how to deal with manure and flies. Regular veterinary appointments are recommended. Older horses are better for first-time horse owners, so foals should only be sold to experienced horse-owners.

habitat: room to roam and climb, and socialization, adequate shelter
food: roughage such as hay and grasses, but they also eat grain, weeds, woody shrubs, and more; constant supply of fresh drinking water
comments: Size varies. Plan on how to deal with manure and flies. Regular veterinary appointments are recommended.

when_fertile: a female rabbit can have up to 3-4 litters each season
habitat: can be raised in a cage, but should be given plenty of time to exercise
food: hay and pellets, fresh vegetables, constant supply of fresh drinking water
comments: Size varies. Plan on how to deal with manure.

habitat: must be kept warm and dry, with space to exercise and the ability to socialize, roost, and nest
food: pellets and grit, constant supply of fresh drinking water
comments: Size varies. Incubation time is indicated under 'gestation period'. Plan on how to deal with manure.

habitat: space to roam, water to splash in, and socialization
food: pellets and grit, constant supply of fresh drinking water
comments: Size varies. Incubation time is indicated under 'gestation period'. Plan on how to deal with manure.

when_fertile: when the female is in heat, which usually occurs several times each year
habitat: space to exercise, socialization/training is required
food: amount varies by breed/age, but after weaning a high-quality kibble is often sufficient; constant supply of fresh drinking water
stimulation: socialization a must for all breeds, exercise  vary by breed and individual dog needs. dogs prefer to be kept indoors with their humans at least part of the time, but some people raise their dogs outdoors in kennels
comments: Size varies by breed. Dog waste should always be cleaned up to avoid transmitting diseases. Rabies vaccinations are generally required in the U.S. Regular veterinary appointments are recommended. Due to shelter overcrowding, breeding dogs should only be done after careful consideration, and any dogs not intended to be bred should not be allowed to reproduce.

when_fertile: when the female is in heat, which usually occurs several times each year
habitat: enough space for comfort, warmth; can grow accustomed to being indoors or outdoors (or both)
food: amount varies by breed/age, but after weaning a high-quality kibble is often sufficient; constant supply of fresh drinking water
comments: Size varies by breed and frame. Cat waste is particularly dangerous for pregnant women to be exposed to. Regular veterinary appointments for cats are recommended. Due to shelter overcrowding, breeding cats should only be done after careful consideration, and any cats not intended to be bred should not be allowed to reproduce.
